oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery interviews Mel Tillis and Terry Bradshaw - Live
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Mel Tillis (performer) and Terry Bradshaw (personality) for Ralph Emery: On the Record With Mel Tillis. Recording is performed in front of a live audience. Recording is from April of 1989.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Mel Tillis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mel Tillis and Terry Bradshaw joke about their work in the Cannonball Run -- (02:53) Ralph Emery asks Bradshaw where he lived, and Bradshaw and Tillis joke about Bradshaw's football career -- (04:46) Bradshaw credits Albert Ruddy for casting him and Tillis for their charisma -- (06:37) Emery asks Bradshaw about who he believes will perform well in the NFL; additionally, Emery and Tillis say goodbye to Bradshaw -- (09:19) Emery discusses the upcoming schedule -- (10:09) Emery invites Tillis to discuss when he was hired to work for Minnie Pearl -- (13:52) Tillis discusses his time with the Duke of Paducah, and Pearl allowing him to perform on stage -- (15:41) Emery inquires about how Pearl discovered Tillis' humorous personality -- (18:27) Emery and Tillis discuss how Tillis stutters -- (22:52) Tillis reflects on his time at Decca Records, and how Red Foley led to Tillis' release -- (24:33) Tillis discusses his time with Cap Records and the number of records he had recorded -- (25:52) Emery invites Tillis to discuss how he meet Danny Dill and the story of "Detroit City" -- (29:48) Tillis recalls that he discovered "Who's Julie" during the Disc Jockey's Convention for MGM Records -- (32:11) Emery inquires about the story of Tillis and Wayne Walker at the Disc Jockey's Convention -- (35:36) Emery speaks of Tillis' accolades, and how Tillis was on the Grand Ole Opry with a pipe -- (37:31) Emery plays a clip from the Country Music Association Awards Show when Tillis won Entertainer of the Year -- (39:23) Tillis recalls how Jimmy Dean had given him a line for his speech when they were out to eat together; additionally, Emery attempts to have Tillis discuss where his career went after he won Entertainer of the Year -- (41:23) Tillis credits Dean for getting Tillis on the Glen Campbell Goodtime Hour -- (42:25) Emery plays multiple clips from Tillis' performances on the Glen Campbell Goodtime Hour -- (43:35) Emery has Tillis address his growing family -- (44:45) Emery plays a clip from a session where Carrie April Tillis played "Mary Had a Little Lamb" for Emery's show -- (45:20) Tillis describes how Carrie became an opera singer -- (46:01) Emery asks Tillis to describe why he adopted Hannah Tillis when he was fifty years old -- (46:58) Emery inquires about one of Tillis' mother's sayings; additionally, Emery praises Tillis' work ethic -- (48:25) Tillis reflects on the difficulties in gaining his father's approval -- (50:45) Tillis praises Pam Tillis' work ethic despite her lack of recognition -- (52:52) Emery and Tillis discuss how Tillis was left a sail boat from Burl Ives -- (55:08) Emery says goodbye to Tillis, and both joke away from the microphone
